intro: Pluchea laxiflora, commonly known as the slenderleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with ray florets that give it a daisy-like appearance. Pluchea laxiflora is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including fields and roadsides.
